relation: Great for these types of students

Southern Utah University is great for the type of students who want to have an adventure. If you want to learn how to put yourslef out there and explore the world around you then SUU is the place for you. You will learn so much not just about academics but about yourself.

The best tip that I can offer is that if you wish to have a job while at SUU you will need to search. In the end most people find a job but it is very difficult so start early in the summer and keep checking in with them. Other tips I would offer is to put yourself out there. If you really get involved at SUU there is no doubt that you will enjoy yourself and you will get rewards for it.
The amount of tuition due at SUU is really worth what you get for it, especially if you get a scholarship. They make many available to you and it is very great way to help out with tuition.

I love being here in Cedar City. It's a small town city which can sometimes take away from the college experience. Overall though it is fun there are so many people here, you will always meet someone new. The more you put yourself out there the more you will enjoy your time at SUU.

I'm learning a lot more than I thought I would. The class sizes are small which makes it a lot easier for the teacher to have one on one time with you. It's not like other colleges where you hear that the teachers don't care because they actually do care about how well you do and if you learn or not. I have never had a teacher who didn't care or a teacher who I didn't like. You will learn so much while you're here.

TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {17857=Within two weeks of being here, I made more friends than I can count. Because the campus is small, you come to know just about everyone. People are friendly and very open. There are so many opportunities for service including trips to Mexico for only $450-$480. Every first Monday of the month we have Bread and Soup Night (all you can eat for $1 and a can of food). My professors honestly care about me and my learning; the campus is safe; there is no winter inversion; thunderstorms are regular and when it rains, the smell of wet sage and pine is crisp and rejuvenating. Not only do I love the location and my classes, I love the clubs on campus. Some of these clubs include ASL, Ukulele, Soccer, and Swing. SUU also has a fine Honors program with plenty perks. One of these perks is a study room exclusive for its students. Recently we took place in the annual SUU homecoming cardboard-duct-tape boat race in the swimming pool. On the flip side, there are always those professors and fellow students who no one enjoys being around. At the moment I am not enjoying my ENGL 2010 class for this reason. My favorite class this semester is UNIV 1000, a seminar dedicated to first semester students. The title of the textbook is Your Expanding Intelligence. It is different, but the learning tools presented are effective and worth knowing how to use. Students are encouraged to think out of the box. We are given principles, then expected to run with them and return with something creative. Professors are open minded. You will not regret it., 227247=Every year, during homecoming week, students participate in True T-Bird Night. At this time, any students who want to be true t-birds, go to the statue of Old Sorrel. And then the kissing begins! To be a true t-bird, you must kiss someone at Old Sorrel at midnight during homecoming. The best part is, everyone gets free chap stick! In 2008 a bell tower was built on the SUU campus. During the holiday seasons, it plays music every hour. This bell tower has also served as a building stone for a new tradition on campus. Students are not to walk underneath the bell tower while on campus. When freshman attend their orientation, they are all walked under the bell tower going west to east, to symbolically say that the sun is rising and they are starting a new time in life. They are not to walk under the bell tower again until graduation. Part of the graduation ceremonies consists of the graduates walking through the bell tower from east to west, as if the sun is setting on this phase of life. This is a new tradition but it has been a lot of fun to integrate into the life of SUU., 180936=We have this giant rock named gunther on campus and every student has the right to paint on it if they clear it with the student center first. It will always help to apply for scholarships and FAFSA!! That is a huge help for me. 2.) Make sure you know your professors' hours when they are available and when they're not. It's less hassle when you and your professors are not busy at the same time. 3.) Just be yourself and no one else. Express yourself in a cool respectful way. OH!!! and... 4.) Make sure you have a CAR! Sometimes it's fun to walk to stores but then again, it sucks not having a car if you need to go to WalMart and shop. That's about it for now.
